column1: #Text=The samples were prepared using pure elements and chemical reagents of commercial products, with weight purities of 99.9% for Sm, 99.5% for Fe, 99.999% for As, and 99.99% for Fe2O3 and MnO2.
#Text=Polycrystalline samples with a nominal composition SmFe1‚àíùë•Mnùë•AsO (ùë•=0, 0.05, 0.010) were synthesized via a two-step solid-state reaction.

#Text=In the first step SmAs was synthesized and then used as a precursor; fine Sm turnings and small As chips were sealed under vacuum in a Pyrex tube, heated up and treated at 560‚àòC for three days in a resistance furnace.
#Text=In the second step, the quaternary SmFe1‚àíùë•Mnùë•AsO oxypnictide was synthesized.

#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of SmAs, Fe, Fe2O3 and MnO2 were well blended and ground together, so as to get a homogeneous mixture, which was then pressed into pellets of 10 mm in diameter (and a mass of ‚âÉ2‚Äì3 g) by using a hydraulic press.

#Text=The pellets, sealed in outgassed Ta crucibles under Ar atmosphere, were closed under vacuum in a SiO2 tube and subjected to the synthesis reaction and sintering in a resistance furnace (1200 ‚àòC for 4 days); then slowly cooled down to room temperature.
